distribution.text: Copyright Â© Red Hat, Inc. All rights reserved.

notes.text:
Updated wireshark packages that fix several security issues are now
available for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 3, 4, and 5.

This update has been rated as having moderate security impact by the Red
Hat Security Response Team.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
Wireshark is a program for monitoring network traffic. Wireshark was
previously known as Ethereal.

Multiple buffer overflow flaws were found in Wireshark. If Wireshark read
a malformed packet off a network or opened a malformed dump file, it could
crash or, possibly, execute arbitrary code as the user running Wireshark.
(CVE-2008-4683, CVE-2009-0599)

Several denial of service flaws were found in Wireshark. Wireshark could
crash or stop responding if it read a malformed packet off a network, or
opened a malformed dump file. (CVE-2008-4680, CVE-2008-4681, CVE-2008-4682,
CVE-2008-4684, CVE-2008-4685, CVE-2008-5285, CVE-2009-0600)

Users of wireshark should upgrade to these updated packages, which contain
Wireshark version 1.0.6, and resolve these issues. All running instances of
Wireshark must be restarted for the update to take effect.
notes.title: Details

publisher.issuing_authority: Red Hat Product Security is responsible for vulnerability handling across all Red Hat offerings.
publisher.name: Red Hat Product Security

document.title: Red Hat Security Advisory: wireshark security update

notes.text: packet-usb.c in the USB dissector in Wireshark 0.99.7 through 1.0.3 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (application crash or abort) via a malformed USB Request Block (URB).
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: CVE-2008-4680 wireshark: DoS (app crash or abort) via malformed USB Request Block (URB).
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

remediations.details:
Before applying this update, make sure that all previously-released
errata relevant to your system have been applied.

This update is available via Red Hat Network.  Details on how to use
the Red Hat Network to apply this update are available at
http://kbase.redhat.com/faq/docs/DOC-11259

vulnerabilities.title: CVE-2008-4680 wireshark: DoS (app crash or abort) via malformed USB Request Block (URB).

notes.text: Unspecified vulnerability in the Bluetooth RFCOMM dissector in Wireshark 0.99.7 through 1.0.3 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (application crash or abort) via unknown packets.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: CVE-2008-4681 wireshark: DoS (app crash or abort) in Bluetooth RFCOMM dissector via unknown packets
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

vulnerabilities.title: CVE-2008-4681 wireshark: DoS (app crash or abort) in Bluetooth RFCOMM dissector via unknown packets

notes.text: wtap.c in Wireshark 0.99.7 through 1.0.3 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (application abort) via a malformed Tamos CommView capture file (aka .ncf file) with an "unknown/unexpected packet type" that triggers a failed assertion.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: CVE-2008-4682 wireshark: DoS (app abort) via a malformed  .ncf file with an unknown/unexpected packet type
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

remediations.details:
Before applying this update, make sure that all previously-released

This update is available via Red Hat Network.  Details on how to use

http://kbase.redhat.com/faq/docs/DOC-11259

vulnerabilities.title: CVE-2008-4682 wireshark: DoS (app abort) via a malformed  .ncf file with an unknown/unexpected packet type

notes.text: The dissect_btacl function in packet-bthci_acl.c in the Bluetooth ACL dissector in Wireshark 0.99.2 through 1.0.3 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (application crash or abort) via a packet with an invalid length, related to an erroneous tvb_memcpy call.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: CVE-2008-4683 wireshark: DoS (app crash or abort) in Bluetooth ACL dissector  via a packet with an invalid length
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

remediations.details:
Before applying this update, make sure that all previously-released

This update is available via Red Hat Network.  Details on how to use

vulnerabilities.title: CVE-2008-4683 wireshark: DoS (app crash or abort) in Bluetooth ACL dissector  via a packet with an invalid length

notes.text: packet-frame in Wireshark 0.99.2 through 1.0.3 does not properly handle exceptions thrown by post dissectors, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (application crash) via a certain series of packets, as demonstrated by enabling the (1) PRP or (2) MATE post dissector.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: CVE-2008-4684 wireshark: DoS (app crash) via certain series of packets by enabling the (1) PRP or (2) MATE post dissector
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

vulnerabilities.title: CVE-2008-4684 wireshark: DoS (app crash) via certain series of packets by enabling the (1) PRP or (2) MATE post dissector

notes.text: Use-after-free vulnerability in the dissect_q931_cause_ie function in packet-q931.c in the Q.931 dissector in Wireshark 0.10.3 through 1.0.3 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (application crash or abort) via certain packets that trigger an exception.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: CVE-2008-4685 wireshark: DoS (app crash or abort) in Q.931 dissector via certain packets
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

cwe.name: Loop with Unreachable Exit Condition ('Infinite Loop')

notes.text: Wireshark 1.0.4 and earlier allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service via a long SMTP request, which triggers an infinite loop.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: CVE-2008-5285 wireshark: DoS (infinite loop) in SMTP dissector via large SMTP request
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

vulnerabilities.title: CVE-2008-5285 wireshark: DoS (infinite loop) in SMTP dissector via large SMTP request

notes.text: The WLCCP dissector in Wireshark 0.99.7 through 1.0.4 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (infinite loop) via unspecified vectors.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: CVE-2008-6472 wireshark: DoS vulnerability in WLCCP dissector
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: Buffer overflow in wiretap/netscreen.c in Wireshark 0.99.7 through 1.0.5 allows user-assisted remote attackers to cause a denial of service (application crash) via a malformed NetScreen snoop file.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: CVE-2009-0599 wireshark: buffer overflows in NetScreen snoop file reader
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

notes.text: Wireshark 0.99.6 through 1.0.5 allows user-assisted remote attackers to cause a denial of service (application crash) via a crafted Tektronix K12 text capture file, as demonstrated by a file with exactly one frame.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: CVE-2009-0600 wireshark: denial of service (application crash) via a crafted Tektronix K12 text capture file
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability
